intro: Helipterum albicans var. auriceps, commonly known as the golden-headed helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas or open woodlands. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while the inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small yellow flowers. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
